content: colorwave hat sara baldwin ©2025 this color pooling hat can be made with any yarn that is skeined at a 71 or 72 inch circumference it will make a stretchy adult hat about 18 inches around of course you can use any yarn to make the hat or any size hat but the colors will not pool in those cases materials sara s colorwave wool yarn about 3 ounces one 16 inch circular needle for fingering weight yarn use a needle size #4 for dk weight yarn use a needle size #6 for worsted weight yarn use a needle size #8 one set of double pointed knitting needles in the same size as your circular needle one circular or double pointed knitting two sizes smaller than above yarn needle size about 18 inches circumference tubular swatch on your circular needle cast on loosely 104 stitches for fingering weight yarn 92 stitches for dk weight yarn and 80 stitches for worsted weight yarn these numbers are my best estimates for a number which will pool the colors but everyone s gauge is different your mileage may vary join being careful not to twist stockinette stitch knit every round about 4 or 5 rounds and carefully observe your color pooling if the color bands spiral upward to the right decrease a stitch or two if the color bands spiral upward to the left increase a stitch or two make a few more rounds adjusting as necessary until you are sure the colors will stack nicely count your stitches this is your final stitch count for the hat add a stitch or two here subtract a stitch or two here now unravel your tubular swatch and cast on the number of stitches that pooled the colors well join and knit every round for about 3 inches purl one round- this will become the folding line for your hem knit around for another 3 inches hem hold your cast on edge behind your active row of knitting with the fold line at the bottom and the wrong side folded to the inside with a circular or double pointed knitting needle two sizes smaller than your main needle pick up your next stitch and a cast-on stitch and knit them together do this all around folding up your hem as you go hat body now resume knitting rounds on your main circular needle until you have about 9 ½ inches of fabric above the fold line edge of your hat top of hat to set up slip 11% of your stitches from your final stitch count onto a double point needle the same size as your main needle slide 26% of your stitches from your final stitch count from your left to your right circular needle tip slip 11% of your stitches from your final stitch count to a second double point needle and 11% to a third double
